intro: Hieracium mosanum, commonly known as the Mosan hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and woodland edges, preferring well-drained soils. It produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Hieracium mosanum is often found in moist or damp habitats and can form dense colonies in suitable conditions.
